title: Computer Science
description: Theory and practice of computers and computational systems, including their theory, design, development, and application.

subtopics.title: Number Systems
subtopics.description: Fundamental concept in computer science used to represent and process data using different base numbering systems such as binary, octal, decimal, hexadecimal, and Base64.

subtopics.title: Binary Number System
subtopics.description: Base-2 number system using only 0 and 1; foundational for digital systems and computers.

subtopics.title: Octal Number System
subtopics.description: Base-8 number system using digits 0 through 7; sometimes used in digital electronics.

subtopics.title: Decimal Number System
subtopics.description: Base-10 number system, the standard numerical system used by humans.

subtopics.title: Hexadecimal Number System
subtopics.description: Base-16 system using digits 0–9 and letters A–F; commonly used in memory addressing and color codes in computing.

subtopics.title: Base64 Encoding
subtopics.description: A binary-to-text encoding scheme that represents binary data using 64 ASCII characters; widely used in data transmission, such as email and image embedding in HTML.

subtopics.title: C++
subtopics.description: High-performance language for systems and games.
